string.text: Kevlar plates
Reinforced plates that last longer, but are not more durable.
Polycarbonate plates
Polycarbonate plates don't last long, but they're more reliable than Kevlar thanks to improved bullet impulse negation.
Duplicate protective plate layer
Armour with an inner layer that spreads impact over a greater area.
Installation of mobile protective plates for joints
Mobile plates protect joints from gunshot wounds.
Segmented protection
Thinner sheets of armour are layered to increase the armour's wear-resistance.
Additional aluminium/titanium plates
Increased number of titanium plates considerably improves body armour durability.
Backup mobile layer
Mobile plates protect joints from wounds.
Thickening leather inserts
While those inserts don't mean improved protection, they do guarantee better durability.
Shield high durability protective frame
Used in suits to improve outfit durability.
Reinforced kevlar plates and inserts
Reinforced plates that last longer to improve outfit durability.
Solid carbon components
Replacing metal with carbon fibre allows the weight of body armour to be reduced without sacrificing reliability.
A lighter aluminium frame
A lighter aluminium frame for plates to replace the steel frame. Reduces armour weight
Installation of lighter synthetic and plastic components
Use of lighter materials to reduce body armour weight.
Lighter, synthetic and polymer materials
Fabric, clips and thickeners are replaced with lighter synthetic materials to reduce armour weight.
A mount system for weight distribution
A system of mounts allows for weight to be distributed onto the whole body more evenly.
A weight distribution back frame
A back frame relieves focused shoulder load from carried weight by distributing it over the body, which increases maximum load.
Additional servomotors
Additional movement devices allow maximum carried load to be increased.
Constantan-based inner layer for isolation
A thin layer of constantan is capable of isolating against electricity.
Constantan thermal isolation inserts
Constantan is capable of isolating against electricity and has a very high melting point.
An isolation bodysuit with manganin inserts
This nickel and magnesium alloy is used in armour to prevent electric shocks.
Fabric treated with a fire-resistant substance
Fabric treated with a fire-resistant substance is popular among stalkers searching for fire artefacts.
Magnesium plate inserts
Magnesium inserts protect the wearer from thermal dangers.
Thermal fibreglass protection
Fiberglass is used in bodysuits worn by natural disaster response teams.
Fire-resistant bodysuit with nickel inserts
Nickel is sufficiently fire-resistant to be used for body armour inserts
Thunderbird constantan face armour
Protective alloy frame to prevent thermal and electrical damage.
Rubberized bodysuit fabric
Rubber is a basic way of protecting yourself from brief radiation exposure.
Plexiglass inner layer for radiation protection
Plexiglass absorbs two types of radiation while being a lot lighter than lead.
Addition of lead to bodysuit
Lead is a reliable defence against radiation because it absorbs all three types thereof.
Active filters
Active filters can resist radioactive particles.
Plexiglass coating
A plexiglass mask can provide partial protection from radiation.
Reinforced respirator for extreme conditions
A filter with an additional purification coating and a system for removal of poisons.
Canvas bodysuit
Basic protection against rain and caustic substances coming into contact with the skin
Airtight plastic inner layer
Even a simple plastic inner layer can protect the wearer from chemical hazard.
Impregnated bodysuit fabric
Impregnated fabric should prevent chemical poisoning.
Lifesaver plexiglass bodysuit with flexible lead mesh
The lead mesh creates unbreachable chemical protection without sacrificing mobility.
Filter for work in contaminated areas
A filter with a reinforced anti-corrosive coating with an additional preventing layer for removal of poisons.
Impregnated breathing mask
Respirator for total blocking of poisons.
A psy-protection band made of paired steel grills
The closed band has been demonstrated to provide partial protection against direct psy-emissions.
Installation of the Psy-Dome band
Hi-tech psy-protection that is said to have been invented by a scientist called Sakharov.
Primary armour attachment module
Installation of an armour attachment module.
Additional armour attachment module
Installation of an additional armour attachment module.
Two-compartment armour attachment module
Installation of two-compartment armour attachment module.
Internal thermal regulation system
An ergonomic improvement: special mounts attached to the bodysuit allow for carried weight to feel lighter.
Athlete built-in system
An experimental model of a running system, which is not used outside the Zone due to its high price and dubious application.
Steam purification and respiration filters
A set of filters used in contaminated air or critical air temperature conditions, which are too low or too high for breathing.
Ray haemostimulator
This small wave emitter is mounted on the back, effectively increasing blood clotting speed when worn constantly.
Hydra haemoglobin injector
Generation B injector, which regularly introduces a coagulation agent into the bloodstream when blood pressure drops significantly.
Fury adrenalin injector

Generation A injector, developed by one of Kiev's research institutes, regularly injects the bloodstream with tiny doses of adrenalin, which may be dangerous but may also save your life in an emergency.
Phoenix restoration system
An integrated system that monitors the wearer's health and supplies vitamins, adrenalin or anabolic substances as required.
Installation of a life support system
This wave emitter is mounted on the neck, and while its mechanism and method of operation are unclear, it has a strong calming effect.
Addition of hydraulic boosters
Installation of hydraulic boosters is a modification that is used for fourth generation exoskeletons. Allows for sprinting in an exoframe.
